result.execSummary:
This case is being appealed. If the court makes a decision in a case that a party disagrees with, the party may have the right to seek review by a higher court to determine if the trial court's decision was correct. Appeals are most often made after a trial or final decision in a case, but an appeal can also occur before a final decision.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consec to any other sentence.  Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: $200 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted. $67 VW surcharge  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Psychiatric/psychological evaluation as deemed appropriate by agent and treatment as recommended.
Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with JJ.   Defendant shall not threaten or direct any acts of physical violence toward anyone.
Completion of aggression/anger management course or treatment.
Court costs remitted. $67  VW surcharge  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.
All other conditions are the same as count 2.

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Patricia Sommer.  Tim Helmberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion to withdraw as counsel. DE informs ct he's not asking her to withdraw, just to proceed in a different manner. Argument. Upon further colloquy with court and attorney, DE requests that counsel be allowed to withdraw. Upon counsel filing for an extension for DE to file postconviction motion, counsel will be granted withdrawal from the case. Counsel suggests court recuse due to today's hearing. DE at this point does not want court to recuse. Ct will leave it up to DE. Atty Sommer to provide order to withdraw to court for signature.

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Mario D. White. Diane Louise Schlipper and Tim Helmberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State orally moves to amend ct 3 back to original verbage. Jury instructions reviewed: 50, 103, 148, 55, 58, 300, 145, 110. Jamilahia Jackson duly sworn and testified. Jury enters at 9:23 AM. Oath to final jury given at 9:24 AM. Jury instructions read. Openings. R. L. G. duly sworn and testified. Direct by State. Cross. Jamilahia J. duly sworn and testified. Direct by State. DE identified. State moves to admit and publish exhibit 1, no objection, admitted. Side bar at 10:38 AM. Ends at 10:39 AM. Court breaks at 10:39 AM. Jury enters from break at 10:59 AM. State continues direct. Exhibit 1 published. Cross. Re-direct. Side bar at 11:41 AM. Ends at 11:43 AM. Side bar at 11:45 AM. Ends at 11:47 AM. Jury excused for lunch at 11:48 AM. Court goes back on record without the jury at 1:33 PM. Per DCSO, DE is refusing to attend trial any further. Court had DE brought up at 1:42 PM. DE reports he would like to appear for the remainder of the trial. Exhibit 2 - transcript of victim's 911 recording, marked and admitted. Jury enters at 2:00 PM. Lateef C. duly sworn and testified. Direct by Atty White. Cross. Re-direct. Eric G. duly sworn and testified. Direct by State. Side bar at 2:13 PM. Ends at 2:15 PM. DE identified. Exhibits 3-8, photos of victim, marked, and admitted. Published to jury. Exhibit 9 - documentation chart for attempted strangulation cases, marked, admitted, and published. Exhibit 10 - 72 No contact form, marked, objection. Side bar at 2:47 PM. Ends at 2:52 PM. Side bar at 2:59 PM. Ends at 3:00 PM. Exhibit 11 - CAD notes, marked and received. Cross. Exhibits 12-16 - photos of DE, marked, admitted, published. Exhibits 17 - 22 - photos of shirt and knife, marked, received. Re-direct. Jury excused for break at 3:49 PM. Jury enters at 4:16 PM. Exhibit 23 - Dr. Curran's CV, marked. Dr. K. Curran duly sworn and testified. Direct by State. Exhibit 23, admitted. Exhibit 26 - Medical record of exam Jamilahia J. 5/27/15, marked, objection. Side bar at 4:23 PM. Ends at 4:25 PM. Objection lifted. Exhibit admitted. Side bar at 4:40 PM. Ends at 4:44 PM. Cross. Re-direct by State. State rests. Jury excused for break at 4:58 PM. DE will not testify. Jury instructions reviewed 100, 157, 150, 147, 148, 145, 115, 1255 - modified, 1900 - modified, 103, 155, 300, 315, 180, 190, 195, 140, 160, 460, 484, 515. Jury enters from break at 5:50 PM. Exhibit 25 - DE 911 call, marked and received. Exhibit 24 admitted. Exhibit 25 published. DE rests. Jury instructions read. Closings. Final jury instructions provided. Alternate juror picked and excused at 7:27 PM. Bailiffs given oath. Jury excused for deliberations at 7:29 PM. Exhibit 27 - copy of State's powerpoint, marked. DE moves for mistrial. Ct holds in abeyance. Jury question at 9:22 PM. Parties go on record without jury present at 9:31 PM to answer jury question. Court addresses motion for mistrial. Court provides rough page of transcript. Court denies motion. Exhibit 28 - page of transcript addressing DE's motion for mistrial, marked. Jury enters with verdict at 10:22 PM. Verdict: ct 1 - not guilty. ct 2 - guilty. ct 3 - guilty. Jury polled. Jury excused at 10:25 PM. State moves for judgment on the verdict, no objection. Ct enters judgment on 3 counts.
Verbiage change only
